summary: The NTIA Policy and Cybersecurity Coordination Act aims to establish an Office of Policy Development and Cybersecurity within the National Telecommunications and Information Administration (NTIA). The bill mandates the office, led by an Associate Administrator, to focus on national communications and information policy, particularly concerning the internet and communication technologies. The office will develop policies promoting innovation, competition, and security, conduct studies, coordinate cybersecurity policy development, and offer advice to the Assistant Secretary on relevant matters.
